meanings.definition: Dye (a fabric) with a color that is darker than the original.
meanings.sent1: She decided to overdye her old dress to make it darker.
meanings.sent2: The tailor will overdye the faded curtains to give them a new look.
meanings.sent3: After the mishap, she accidentally overdye her white shirt black!
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds seemed to overdye the sky with a deep shade of gray.
meanings.sent5: The artist used a special technique to overdye the canvas with rich hues.

meanings.definition: Dye (a fabric) again with a different color.
meanings.sent1: To create a unique pattern, she chose to overdye the fabric with a vibrant blue.
meanings.sent2: The fashion designer decided to overdye the coat to match the new collection.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally overdye his socks pink while trying to fix the color.
meanings.sent4: The sunset seemed to overdye the horizon with shades of orange and pink.
meanings.sent5: The chef's experiment to overdye the pasta with beet juice resulted in a surprising color.
